channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two One Way Street Signs Broken, 26th November
item.description:
The One Way Sign on Thicket Road near the junction of Anerley Park Road has been damaged causing the light to flicker off and one. The light has stopped working on a similar sign about one hundred yards away on Thicket Road, near the pedestrian gate to Crystal Palace Park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Driving on path, 26th November
item.description:
Vehicles have destroyed the grass verge and are driving on the pavement to get to the traffic lights Main Rd/Sevenoaks Way by the entrance to the old Homebase store. Something needs to be done to stop this before somebody gets hurt!

item.title: Assorted rubbish, dumped on the green intersection by Marble Arch Underground/Park Lane/Marble Arch, 26th November
item.description:
Many bags of rubbish, litter, stolen shopping trolleys- all abandoned there by the illegal vagrant encampment, set up by the organised illegal beggars (who quite likely do not have any legal right to be in the UK). This is part of the issue of the illegal encampment there. There is NO DRAINAGE. There will likely be human waste. There will likely be rats (pests). Huge public health risk. Right next to Marble Arch Underground station and Oxford St. Two of the busiest parts of the city. The scale/size of the dumped rubbish has DOUBLED in the last 48 hours. I predicted and warned that the problem would get worse-and it has. Reported this issue, over and over. Westminster Police: do nothing. TfL: the landlord of this plot-do nothing. Mayor (also Chair of TfL): does nothing. GLA: no action UK Home Office-Immigration Enforcement: do nothing. (Along with the rest of central govt.) Westminster City Council: v v slow to act. Hopefully they will do something.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Lane, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thick leaves getting soggy and slippery, 26th November
item.description:
The leaves always collect and sit outside our house on the pavement as we are opposite a road. They get thick and very slippery and soggy. Please could they be cleared. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Scott's Lane, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated Issue with northbound pothole, 26th November
item.description:
This pothole was repaired by Southwark several times and has reopened in the identical location. Since October, passing buses and HGVs cause my walls and bed to shake, waking me at night. My property is 1 of 2 houses adjacent to this defect. I am concerned about structural damage to my home and the tunnels beneath from months of repeated vibration. LEGAL: Section 41 Highways Act 1980: Southwark has a statutory duty to maintain this highway. Section 79 Environmental Protection Act 1990: Vibration is included in the definition of statutory nuisance. The ongoing vibration substantially interferes with my use and enjoyment of my home. Please log this as a statutory nuisance complaint. Article 8 Human Rights Act 1998: I have the right to respect for my home. Months of sleep disruption constitutes interference with this right. REQUIRED: Urgent inspection, investigation of repeated failure at this location, permanent repair (not a patch), and written confirmation of timescales. If unresolved, an FOI request will follow for inspection records and formal escalation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wait button is not working., 26th November
item.description:
Crossing at Bedford Way, Tavistock Square, Gordon Square. Outside Tavistock hotel. Press the WAIT button and all the wait buttons are illuminated red. Traffic light went through several cycles of letting cars go both ways Over a few minutes. No pedestrian crossing activated. Pedestrians were also trying to use other wait buttons at other parts of the junction. Tried button multiple times and waited. So several pedestrians crossing the road without there being the green pedestrian signal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedford Way, St Pancras, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
